alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Campbell; Scott; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 10:21AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Campbell, Scott and Union. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1121 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clinton, La Follette, Oliver Springs, Jacksboro, Caryville, Rocky Top, Norris, Disney, Cove Lake State Park, Norris Dam State Park, Rosedale, Smokey Junction, Andersonville, Fincastle, Big Ridge State Park and Frozen Head State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
